question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracket Okibe was rusticated for his [derogatory] remark about the principal
subject: english-language
explanation: Unsavoury means unpleasant or morally offensive, the most suitable synonym for derogatory in this regard.

question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracketSome men will continue to cause offences until they are given [a taste of their own medicine]
subject: english-language
explanation: Revenged on is the correct answer. To have 'a taste of your own medicine' is to have the same unpleasant experience that one has caused another.

question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracketJustice is difficult to enforce because people are unwilling to accept any loss of [sovereignty]
subject: english-language
explanation: Autonomy is the correct answer. Sovereignty means a situation of self-sufficiency and self-governance.

question_text: His many years of success in legal practise.... didn't come out without challenges
subject: english-language
explanation: However is used when trying to include a new point, or buttress an old one with a comparison

question_text: Choose the word that has the same rhyme schemeThyme
subject: english-language
explanation: 'Time' sounds approximately the same way when pronounced as 'Thyme'

question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracketThere are still [virtous] women in our society today
subject: english-language
explanation: Upright is correct answer. Virtuous means having and demonstrating high level of moral standards or ethics, which is the same as being upright,

question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracket.This type of response is [typical] of a lazy teacher
subject: english-language
explanation: Characteristic is correct answer. A thing is described as 'typical' of something else when becomes an observable and noticeable quality or attribute of it.

question_text: Choose the word with the same vowel sound as the one in bracketOrthop[ae]dic
subject: english-language
explanation: Elite is the correct answer. The vowel /i:/ pronounced as 'eee' (as in letter E e.g. tea) sound is present

question_text: Choose the word with the same vowel sound as the one in bracketBand[a]ge
subject: english-language
explanation: The vowel /i/ as in bit is present here. Only the very last sound pronunciation of 'cacophony' bears the same answer.Â

question_text: Read the Passage carefully and answer the questions that follow.The term Mass Communication occurs when information is disseminated to a relatively large number of people in different places. it should be seen as the same thing with talking face to face with someone else. With mass communication, there is no answer, smile, laugh or lock of surprise. the people who receive the message are as far away from the source of the message as far away as you are from the announcers on the radio or from the newscasters on television, or from the writer of a column in the local newspaper.There are three identifiable means of errors in mass communication. There is one done through the printed words, books, magazine and newspapers. The other is primarily radio, but also records and tape recordings. Also, it can be done through a combination of sound and pictures as in television, films and the more recently popular video tape.Together, they are referred to as the mass media.All media can be used to inform and entertain. However, there are coverts roles played. It may be to educate as in school broadcast. Again, the aim may be to persuade as when the media are used by advertisers or for political broadcasts. The media are often in strong position to influence public opinion because they select the topics to be presented and can stress the importance of one issue over the other.The mass media have, in recent times, come under acerbic criticism. Many presenters have become not only conscientized but also immensely concerned about the possible effects that science of violence and bad behavior may have on their children. More worrisome are the potential danger of political and commercial propaganda.Â Â A suitable title for the above passage can be:
subject: english-language
explanation: The passage is expository enough to largely cover mass communication as a career, practice, relative importance and societal impact andÂ effect.

options.answer: The mass media and the people
The good and the bad side of the media

More worrisome are the potential danger of political and commercial propaganda.Â Â The means of mass media can be summarized into:
subject: english-language
explanation: Mass mediaÂ means technology that is intended to reach aÂ massÂ audience. It is the primary means ofÂ communicationÂ used to reach the vast majority of the general public. The most common platforms forÂ mass mediaÂ according to the passage are newspapers, magazines, radio, television. These can be summarized into print (Newspaper, magazines) and electronic (Radio and Television)

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"The significance of Mr Bello's advice to Aliya on Bobo's gift is that
subject: english-language
explanation: The significance of Mr Bello's advice is that the recipient of a gift shouldn't out of indebtedness feel obliged to act upon the gesture of the giver, as such doesn't necessarily mean true love and affection.

options.answer: the gift a demonstration of love and affection
the gift shouldn't necessarily impose an obligation on Aliya to act in tune with Bobo's interest
one of the foundations of his marriage with Aliya's mother is through gifting
once a boy gives a girl a gift it necessarily means that he has an interest in mind

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"Aliya although is born with a silver spoon, but she has no freedom to move around meet new people unlike other persons. This signals to the...
subject: english-language
explanation: Aliya at age 12 envy of the girls hawking on the street and their freedom to move about as compared to her restriction to move about, eventhough she born into a comfortable home, significantly indicates the irony of life i.e no one has it all.

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"It may be argued that Chapter Two is titled, "The Drive" particularly because...?
subject: english-language
explanation: Readers must see through the meanings of words and titles beyond their ordinarily usage where necessary. Aliya's drive home by Mr Bello is relevant not because of the drive but especially because Mr Bello used the opportunity of the informal atmosphere to educate his daughter about sexual maturity and the realities of life pictured by the hawking girls and their aspiration to be great in life.

options.answer: of the social disparity between the rich and the poor which is unlikely to end
Aliya's father drove her home from the boarding house
it indicates the realities and experiences shared during Mr Bello's drive with Aliya
it was the best atmosphere for Mr Bello to scold Aliya for her wrongdoings

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"The fact that Aliya wanted to be a pilot, then a musician, a songwriter, doctor and later a lawyer points to the
subject: english-language
explanation: The youthfulness and ambition as well as confusion that comes with choosing a career is evident at every child's tender age. Parents should only guide their children as to the choice of their career based on passion and not on prospects of the course or career only.

options.answer: need for parents to choose a befitting career for their children
reason that only passion can define one's career
indecision that comes with choosing a career at a tender age
need for schools to make their syllabus career based

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen""The Gandhi Test" indicates how
subject: english-language
explanation: Test is that 'you can tell if what you're doing is good or bad, if you want other people to know about it' which means that one should act and be mindful that people are watching.

options.answer: stubborn people act without thinking of public perception
one should act when it comes to choosing a career
a child should make wise decisions mindless of popular thinking
a person can make morally right decisions

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"Bobo proved Mr Bello's advice on infatuation as right when he
subject: english-language
explanation: The fact that Bobo later travelled to Ireland without even informing Aliya finally and undoubtedly cements Mr Bello's advice that his love for her was temporary.

options.answer: eventually left for Ireland without saying a word to Aliya

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"The writer tried to point out religious intolerance in his book, by
subject: english-language
explanation: The condemnation of Aliya and some of her Muslim friends to hell because they are non-christians and murderers by one of Aliya's classmates is indicative of religious intolerance.

options.answer: discussing how the society believes certain religion is better than others
using one of Aliya's classmates to condemn her religion
demonstrating how the religious institutions forcefully impose their beliefs on the people
painting Islam as a more righteous religion that others

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"... is quick to anger and doesn't hide it when she is
subject: english-language
explanation: Mrs Bello doesn't hide her anger whenever she is, she outter speaks her mind on the issue. Although she may not agree with her husband on something, she supports him however.

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"Aliya's choice of wanting to study medicine ...
subject: english-language
explanation: Aliya's interest in medicine was just so that she could help asthmatic children in the nearest future by donating inhalers to schools.

options.answer: is born out of the prospects of the course
is primarily because of her father

question_text: Questions below are based on Bolaji Abdullahi's "Sweet Sixteen"Mr Bello's best advice to Aliya on dating is that
subject: english-language
explanation: Seeing as dating is a challenging adventure even for adults, Aliya is advised to thread softly.

options.answer: she should wait for the right time
she should never be committed to anyone

question_text: He was both a writer and a politician, but he was better ........ a singer
subject: english-language
explanation: The preposition "as" is the most suitable answer here to govern the noun phrase "a singer".

question_text: Vacancies in the company will be notified by .....
subject: english-language
explanation: Apparently, advertisement is one the most viable means by which a company could publicize its vacancy news among others.

question_text: The driver was short of petrol, so he ........ down the road with the engine switched off
subject: english-language
explanation: To 'glide' means to move easily and effortlessly without stopping or making noise.

question_text: He started his career as an ........ teacher
subject: english-language
explanation: Auxiliary being an adjective to the noun "teacher" indicates providing supplementary or extra help, support or assistance.

question_text: His many years of success in legal practise ........ didn't come out without challenges
subject: english-language
explanation: However is used when trying to include a new point, or buttress an old one with a comparison.

question_text: Jide couldn't have said that. This means that Jide
subject: english-language
explanation: "Couldn't have" here indicates the past impossibility of the fact that Jide said it is at all i.e it is untrue or rather unlikely for Jide to have said it.

options.answer: it's not likely jide said it

question_text: Bolu shall be the M.C. This means that
subject: english-language
explanation: The usage of the word "shall" shows compulsion and creates an impression as to the inevitability of Bolu acting as the Compere or Master of Ceremonies (M.C).

options.answer: no one else will be the M.C
later in life, Bolu will become an M.C
Bolu may not be the M.C

question_text: Bridget denied that she wasn't there. This means that
subject: english-language
explanation: First, to deny is to say that something is not true. Therefore, Bridget couldn't have said it is untrue (deny) that she wasn't there, which means she was actually there and she refuses to admit otherwise.

options.answer: She confessed that she wasn't there
She owned up not to be there

question_text: Hadn't it rained, it wouldn't have been so bad
subject: english-language
explanation: The usage of the anomalous verb 'had' alongside with the negatives; 'not' and that in 'wouldn't' means that, it actually rained and that didn't make things good or go as it would have been preferred.

options.answer: It was so bad because it didn't rain
it rained and so it wasn't bad
it wasn't bad because it rained
it rained and that made it so bad

question_text: If he had spoken up, he wouldn't have been given. This means that
subject: english-language
explanation: The implication of the entire statement is that, the speaker or person didn't speak up and so he was given...(an Award or a Microphone or whatever as the case maybe).

options.answer: he spoke up and was given
he wasn't given because he spoke up
he didn't speak up and wasn't given

question_text: Choose the one opposite in meaning to the word(s) in underlined.The police officer looks pudgy

question_text: Choose the one opposite in meaning to the word(s) in underlined.After the wedding, the wife became anorexic
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the one opposite in meaning to the word(s) in underlined.Procrastination is the enemy of progress

question_text: Choose the one opposite in meaning to the word(s) in underlined.I abhor a traitor

question_text: Choose the one nearest in meaning to the word(s) in bracketThis type of response is [typical] of a lazy teacher

question_text: READ THE PASSAGE CAREFULLY AND ANSWER THE QUESTIONS THAT FOLLOW.With its radiant color and plant-like shape, the sea anemone looks more like a flower than animal. More specifically, the sea anemone is formed quite like a flower for which is named, with body like a stem and tentacles like petals in brilliant shades; blue, pink, green and red. Its diameters vary from about six millimeters in some species to more than ninety centimeters in the giant verities of Australia. Like corals, hydras and jelly fish, sea anemones are coelenterates. They can move slowly, but more often they attach the lower part of their cylindrical bodies to rocks, shells or wharf pilings.The upper and end of the sea anemone has a mouth surrounded by tentacles which the animal uses to capture its food. Stinging cells in the tentacles throw out tiny poison threads that paralyze other small sea animals. The tentacles then drag this prey into the sea anemone's mouth.The food is digested in the large inner body cavity. When disturbed, a sea anemone retracts its lump on a rock. Anemones may reproduce by forming eggs. dividing in half or developing buds that grow and break off as independent animals.Which of the following is the main topic of the passage?Â
subject: english-language
explanation: The extract plainly is an exposition to the nature and attributes of sea anemones.

options.answer: A comparison of land and sea animals

explanation: 'Either' is used when there is an alternative choice or decision to be made.

question_text: Either Buntu or you ........ to go
subject: english-language
